name: One Seed Juniper
climate: Typically found in arid or semi-arid climates, with low rainfall.
Adapted to regions with hot, dry summers and mild winters.
Thrives in environments with significant temperature fluctuations.
Can grow in high desert climates with significant year-round sunlight.
sunlight: Requires full sun exposure for optimal growth and health.
Can tolerate partial shade, but growth rate may be reduced.
Adapted to intense sunlight conditions typical of desert environments.
Benefits from unobstructed sun exposure throughout the day.
watering: Exhibits drought tolerance and requires minimal watering once established.
Watering should be infrequent but deep to encourage strong roots.
Natural rainfall is often sufficient; avoid overwatering to prevent root rot.
During prolonged dry spells, moderate watering may be necessary occasionally.
soil: Well-drained sandy or rocky soils are ideal for the One Seed Juniper.
Can tolerate poor, nutrient-poor soils typical of its native environments.
Soil pH can range from slightly acidic to slightly alkaline for best results.
Avoid heavy clay soils that retain water, as this can lead to root issues.
extra_care_tip: Pruning should be done carefully to maintain shape and prevent disease.
Mulching can help retain soil moisture and reduce weed growth around the plant.
